title: Trump escalates trade war with Europe in bid to acquire Greenland
subhed: The US president vowed Saturday to impose a wave of increasingly steep tariffs on several European allies, including France, until the United States is allowed to purchase the Danish autonomous territory. The move marks yet another blow to the transatlantic alliance.

title: From Monroe to Trump: Two centuries of US interference in Latin America
Portugal votes in a presidential election full of uncertainty
Paris apartment collapses during party, one badly injured
subhed: The floor of the fifth-floor apartment caved in during a gathering of around 50 people on Saturday night in the French capital's 11th arrondissement, police said.

title: By appearing with a royal heiress, Jordan Bardella risks blurring his image
subhed: The president of the far-right Rassemblement National presents himself as the 'authentic spokesperson for a France despised by the elites,' yet was photographed in the company of the daughter of Prince Carlo of Bourbon-Two Sicilies, Duke of Castro.
byline: By Ariane Chemin and Ivanne Trippenbach

title: New York rapper A$AP Rocky makes comeback in new album, balancing fury and serenity
subhed: After an eight-year wait, the artist – and Rihanna's partner – has released his fourth album, 'Don't Be Dumb.' The varied and accomplished record features collaborations with Tim Burton, Tyler, The Creator, Doechii and Damon Albarn.

title: 'Trump, hands off Greenland!': From Nuuk to Copenhagen, thousands rally against US annexation plan
subhed: Thousands marched in the capitals of Greenland and Denmark, united in their rejection of Donald Trump's expansionist ambitions for the Inuit island.

subhed: Following the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, who has led Venezuela since 2013, Le Monde collected accounts from residents of Caracas and its suburbs.

title: Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
subhed: The former head of artificial intelligence research at Meta explains his decision to start a new company focused on the physical world, citing strategic differences with the American tech giant and predicting a 'third AI revolution' in the coming years.
byline: By David Larousserie and Alexandre Piquard

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear white in winter?
subhed: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.
